title: Understanding Gaussian Distribution
text: A Gaussian distribution, also known as a normal distribution, is a bell-shaped curve that is symmetric about the mean. It is characterized by its mean and standard deviation.

title: Standard Deviation in Gaussian Distribution
text: In a Gaussian distribution, the standard deviation is a measure of the spread of the data around the mean. It tells us how much the data deviates from the mean.

title: Empirical Rule
text: The empirical rule states that for a normal distribution, approximately 68% of the data falls within one standard deviation of the mean, 95% within two standard deviations, and $$99.7\%$$ within three standard deviations.

title: Applying the Empirical Rule
text: Based on the empirical rule, what percentage of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean in a Gaussian distribution?
